alert.note: Alert for Tripp (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 1:30AM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Tripp County through 330 AM CDT... At 230 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles west of Ideal to 8 miles northwest of Clearfield to 6 miles southwest of Millboro. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Ideal and Millboro around 245 AM CDT. Clearfield around 250 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Wewela, Dog Ear Lake, Hamill and Colome. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for south central South Dakota.
